#Text=Jafar Khan
#Text=Jafar Khan Zand , ( Persian : جعفر خان زند‎ ) was the seventh shah ( king ) of the Zand dynasty from 1785 to 1789 .
#Text=He was the son of Sadiq Khan Zand , who was removed from the throne in Shiraz by Ali Murad Khan , who had previously taken Isfahan for himself .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Early life
#Text=In February 1781 , the Zand prince Ali Murad Khan put Jafar Khan 's father Sadiq Khan Zand and all his brothers to death when he invaded Shiraz .
#Text=Jafar Khan was the only one who was spared , because he privately had reached an agreement with Ali Murad Khan .
#Text=While Ali Murad Khan was in northern Iran in 1785 , Jafar Khan took the opportunity to besiege Isfahan .
#Text=Ali Murad Khan then marched towards the city in order to defend it , but died on 11 February at Murchakhur , a town near Isfahan .
#Text=Reign
#Text=Jafar Khan then crowned himself as the new Zand king in Isfahan .
#Text=At the same time , the Qajar warlord Agha Mohammad Khan marched towards Isfahan .
#Text=Jafar Khan then sent his men to stop his advance towards the city , but they withdrew at Qum without even putting any resistance .
#Text=Jafar Khan then sent an even larger Zand army towards Agha Mohammad Khan , who defeated the army near Kashan .
#Text=Jafar Khan then fled to Shiraz .
#Text=Agha Mohammad afterwards arrived to Isfahan , where he discovered what was left of the Zand treasure and Jafar Khan 's harem . [ 1 ]
#Text=The Qajar troops then looted the city .
#Text=In 1786 , while Agha Mohammad Khan was in northern Iran , Jafar Khan quickly marched towards Isfahan and re-captured it .
#Text=He then sent troops towards Kashan and Qum , while he marched towards Hamadan .
#Text=He was , however , defeated by local tribal chieftains , such as a certain Khosrow Khan and Mohammad Hosayn Khan Qaragozlu . [ 2 ]
#Text=Jafar Khan then withdrew to Isfahan .
#Text=When Agha Mohammad Khan heard about the Zand invasion of Isfahan and its surroundings , he quickly marched towards the city , which made Jafar Khan retreat back to Shiraz once again .
#Text=In 1788 , Agha Mohammad advanced closely to Shiraz , where he hoped to bait Jafar Khan out of Shiraz , which was strongly fortified , making it very hard to besiege .

#Text=Unfortunately for Agha Mohammad Khan , Jafar Khan stayed in the city , which made Agha Mohammad Khan return to Isfahan , where appointed his brother Ali Qoli as its new governor , thus succeeding Jafar Qoli Khan .
#Text=He then left for Tehran . [ 3 ]
#Text=With Agha Mohammad once again in the north , Jafar Khan began raising an army to prepare another attack against Isfahan and its surroundings .
#Text=When Ali Qoli found out about it , he sent a group of tribesmen to a city south to Isfahan , named Qumishah .
#Text=However , Jafar Khan managed to easily defeat them .
#Text=Ali Qoli thereafter retreated to Kashan . [ 3 ]
#Text=Agha Mohammad Khan , learning of this , rapidly marched towards Isfahan , which made Jafar Khan withdraw to Shiraz once again .
#Text=Agha Mohammad Khan , who was too unconfident to try and capture Shiraz , then went back to Tehran .
#Text=Jafar Khan was murdered on 23 January 1789 by Ali Murad Khan 's son Sayed Murad Khan .
#Text=After his death , a four-month civil war began between several Zand princes who fought for succession to the throne .
#Text=Jafar Khan 's son Lotf Ali Khan emerged being the victor in this civil war in May . [ 3 ]
#Text=Issue
#Text=Sons
#Text=Prince Lotf Ali Khan Zand
#Text=Prince Khosrow Khan Zand
#Text=Prince Abbas Qoli Khan Zand
#Text=Prince Najaf Ali Khan Zand
#Text=Daughter(s)
#Text=Princess Maryam Begum Zand
